summary: npm install fails on Windows with MSVC 2017 due to three cross-platform compatibility issues: non-cross-OS build script in core-bridge, OS-specific cargo artifact spawning, and isolated-vm compilation errors with Windows macro expansion.
userImpact: Windows developers cannot install the TypeScript SDK, blocking adoption on Windows platforms.
rootCause: Build scripts use OS-specific paths and spawning mechanisms; isolated-vm compilation fails due to Windows macro name collision with std::max.
proposedFix: Refactor build scripts to be cross-platform compatible; fix macro collision in isolated-vm bindings.
resolutionDetails: Author prepared fixes in fork and PR was welcomed by maintainers to address the outstanding Windows support issue #12.
keyQuote: I have the required changes in my fork ready for a PR. This is great, we've had an outstanding issue to support windows build for a while now #12. PR will be very welcome.
